devdoc.author: xanewok.eth

params.initializer: needs to be an address of the contract or the sender
params.poolBet: The amount of money that the player enters with. Use 18 decimals, just like for $CFTI
params.roundNum: The round when the game will be played. Must be bigger than the current round
params.startingRoll: The upper roll that the game begins with

currentRound().details: We piggyback on the RaidParty batch seeder for our game round abstraction

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: Shuffled randomly players from the given ones, using supplied seed

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: A Death Roll-inspired game for Raid Party

calcGameId(address,uint256).notice: Calculates the game identifier for a given game initializer and roundNum

canCollectReward(address,bytes32).notice: Returns whether the player is eligible to collect a prize for a given game

commenceGame(bytes32).notice: Simulates a given game, assuming it's been seeded since its creation

currentGlobalGameId().notice: Returns a game identifier for the currently running, global game

getLoser((address[],uint256[],uint256)).notice: Given a game result, return an address of a player who lost

getPendingGames(address).notice: Returns a list of outstanding games for the player

getPendingRewards(address).notice: Returns a total amount of claimable rewards by the player

getSeed(uint256).notice: Return generated random words for a given game round

joinGame(bytes32).notice: Join the given game. Needs $CFTI approval as the player needs to deposit the pool bet in order to play.

joinGlobalGame().notice: A convenient method to join the currently running global game

withdrawRewards().notice: Process and clear every outstanding game, collecting the rewards

userdoc.notice: The games uses $CFTI, the native Raid Party token
